coapthon2.layer package¶

Submodules¶

coapthon2.layer.message module¶

class coapthon2.layer.message.MessageLayer(parent)[source]¶

Bases: object

Handles message functionality: Acknowledgment, Reset.

handle_message(message)[source]¶

Handles ACK and RST. Handles mapping with the response previously sent and verify if an Observing relation must be deleted.

Parameters:message – the message received
matcher_response(response)[source]¶

Sets MID if not already set. Save the sent message for acknowledge and duplication handling.

Parameters:response – the response
Returns:the response
Raises AttributeError:
 if the message destination is not properly set.
static reliability_response(request, response)[source]¶

Sets Message type according to the request

Parameters:
  • request – the request object
  • response – the response object
Returns:

the response

coapthon2.layer.observe module¶

class coapthon2.layer.observe.ObserveLayer(parent)[source]¶

Bases: object

Handles the Observing feature.

add_observing(resource, response)[source]¶

Add an observer to a resource and sets the Observe option in the response.

Parameters:
  • resource – the resource of interest
  • response – the response
Returns:

response
notify(node)[source]¶

Finds the observers that must be notified about the update of the observed resource.

Parameters:node (coapthon2.utils.Tree) – the node which has the deleted resource
Returns:the list of commands that must be executed to notify clients
notify_deletion(node)[source]¶

Finds the observers that must be notified about the cancellation of the observed resource.

Parameters:node (coapthon2.utils.Tree) – the node which has the deleted resource
Returns:the list of commands that must be executed to notify clients
prepare_notification(t)[source]¶

Create the notification message.

Parameters:t ((resource, host, port, token)) – the arguments of the notification message
Returns:the notification message
prepare_notification_deletion(t)[source]¶

Create the notification message for deleted resource.

Parameters:t ((resource, host, port, token)) – the arguments of the notification message
Returns:the notification message
remove_observer(response, resource)[source]¶

Remove an observer for a certain resource.

Parameters:
  • response – the response message which has not been acknowledge
  • resource – the resource
remove_observers(node)[source]¶

Remove all the observers of a resource and notifies the delete of the resource observed.

Parameters:node (coapthon2.utils.Tree) – the node which has the deleted resource
Returns:the list of commands that must be executed to notify clients
send_notification(t)[source]¶

Sends a notification message.

Parameters:t – (the notification message, the resource)
update_relations(node, resource)[source]¶

Update a relation. It is used when a resource change due a POST request, without changing its path.

Parameters:
  • node (coapthon2.utils.Tree) – the node which has the deleted resource
  • resource – the new resource

Bases: object

Handles the Resources.

add_resorce(request, response, old, lp, p)[source]¶

Render a POST on aa new resource.

Parameters:
  • request – the request
  • response – the response
  • old (coapthon2.utils.Tree) – the node which has the parent of the resource
  • lp – the location_path attribute of the resource
  • p – the local path of the resource (only the last section of the split path)
Returns:

the response
